name: BOYSEN®® Heat Resisting Aluminum Paint B‑95

info.title: DESCRIPTION
info.body: BOYSEN®® Heat Resisting Aluminum Paint B‑95 is formulated for surfaces subject to heat with peak temperatures of 400°C.

info.title: PRINCIPAL USES
info.body: It is specially formulated for metal surfaces with high heat coating requirements.

info.title: SERVICE CONDITIONS
info.body: Applied coating will dry once peak temperature is reached.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: Metal Surfaces
info.body: Wipe the surface with a rag soaked in paint thinner to remove grease, oil, wax and other foreign matter. For new galvanized surfaces, etch the surface by applying 10% BOYSEN®® Metal Etching Solution B‑71 (Dilute 1 part of B‑71 to 9 parts water). Rinse with water and dry immediately. Unpainted galvanized surfaces that have been exposed for 6 months or more need not be etched. Treat rusted steel by sanding and wire brushing. Use BOYSEN®® Metal Etching Solution B‑71 on remaining rust. Let it stay for 10-15 minutes. Be sure to remove all remaining residue.

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.body: Apply 2-3 coats of BOYSEN®® Heat Resisting Aluminum Paint B‑95 on bare substrate. Wait for first coat to dry upon reaching peak temperatures before applying the succeeding coats.
